personalInfo.bio: I'm vikram sahay a small town guy lliving in delhi to full fill his dreams. By profession an entrepreneur running fitness coaching business. And by passion  musician. Love to talk and travel. Talking to people and traveling is what I love the most. Having a deep intellectual or fun conversation specially with a stranger is what a value the most. In my free time i like to sing, play guitar and i like to play sports like cricket, badminton, horse riding and chess etc. I started working at the age of 16 right now i'm 23 year old and from being a introvert and a underconfident guy to super confident, skillfull and a master at my work achieviing all the things i've ever dreamt of it's been a roller coster ride and a wonder full journey. I've trained more than 1500 people in marketing, sales, personallity development and much more. I've worked in varity of domains like worked with paytm, in a kfc store, exide inssurence, use to be a event manager, did music shows, started my own company, worked in BPO's, started fitness coaching and what not, did varity of things so you can call me a jack of all, master of none, but oftentimes better than a master of one. i'm always up for a long drive or a ride or you want to visit some historical places or a museum and specially if its a fitness activity. i'm a guy with great sense of humer and great knowledge of varity of domain's. i'm a guy who will always be there if you need whether for a emotional support or for a gossipe or a casual chat or you want to resolve a serious problem.

personalInfo.bio:
I was born in 1995 in Delhi, and for the past five years I’ve been living in Faridabad. My early education was at DAV, and afterwards I began pursuing Chartered Accountancy. I completed studies up to CA Inter, but didn’t clear the full certification.

Following that setback, I transitioned my studies toward earning an MBA and LLB, equipping myself with broader skills and perspectives. My professional journey began during articleship, which led to my first job in a mid-level firm. After gaining experience, I moved to ISSC, where I’ve been working for the last four years.

Parallel to my formal education and work, I’ve been deeply involved in emotional support and peer counseling. For over several years, I’ve served as a listener on 7Cups.com (username friendlytalk), providing empathy, encouragement, and support to people all over the world. I’ve had the privilege of helping 2000+ individuals, guiding them through challenging times via listening and conversation.

My strengths lie in active listening, understanding others’ struggles, and offering non-judgmental support. I believe in the power of simple presence—sometimes the best help is to just let someone feel heard.

A qualified Chartered Accountant by profession, he finds joy not just in numbers, but also in the richness of life beyond work. personalInfo.bio: My name is Chirag Dua, a qualified Chartered Accountant from Khanna, Punjab. I’m a people person—comfortable striking up conversations and often the one making others laugh. Though admittedly lazy at times, I enjoy driving through the mountains and spending quality time with my close-knit circle of friends and family. I’m deeply attached to my parents and passionate about social causes like Swachh Bharat Abhiyan. I love discussing everything from tech and cricket to social issues, especially after a drink! Once into gyming, I now prefer yoga whenever time permits—on other days, I happily lean into my laid-back nature.

personalInfo.bio: I’m a finance professional specializing in the audit of financial statements, with a strong foundation in accounting and compliance. I hold a Bachelor of Commerce degree from SAC, Delhi University, and bring a disciplined, detail-oriented approach to my work. Born into a Hindu Rajput family (Gotra: Bhardwaj) from Sitamarhi, Bihar, I’ve had the privilege of experiencing life across India—having completed my schooling in five different schools across the country, thanks to my father’s service in the Indian Army. Being an army brat has shaped my adaptability, resilience, and appreciation for diverse cultures and perspectives. I’m fluent in Hindi and English, and outside of work, I enjoy cooking, playing sports (especially cricket), and engaging in meaningful conversations. Known for my strong communication skills

personalInfo.bio: I am 34 year old chartered accountant who was born in Mathura and brought up in Delhi in a nuclear family consisting of my parents and elder brother. My father is an engineer from IIT Roorkee and worked his entire career at Indian Oil from where he eventually retired as a Director from the Baroda Refinery. Since his job was a transferrable job I've also had the opportunity to visit numerous cities across the country including Haldia, Panipat and Baroda for short stays. My mother is a homemaker and MA in Sanskrit. I've done my entire schooling and college education from Delhi itself. I started my professional journey at EY in 2011. I have had the opportunity to live and work across the world including France, Germany and most recently Australia where I was based for 6.5 years. I got married in 2020 and have 2 beautiful children (4.5 and 3 yrs old respectively).

personalInfo.bio:
I was born in June 1994 in the small city of Sri Karanpur, located in the Sri Ganganagar district of Rajasthan. My permanent residence is in Sri Ganganagar, where I lived until completing my senior secondary education. I later moved to New Delhi to pursue a Bachelor of Commerce (Honours) from Shri Ram College of Commerce (SRCC), University of Delhi.

I began my professional journey with EY India in August 2014 as a CA article assistant and qualified as a Chartered Accountant in November 2019. Since then, I have worked with several prominent organizations, including EY India, Mazars, Grant Thornton, and PwC Global. For the past two years, I have been with ISSC, where I currently serve as a Senior Manager.

Beyond my family, education, and professional journey, I am a naturally inquisitive person and a passionate sports enthusiast. During my school days, I played badminton at the state level and was actively involved in the school volleyball, cricket, and badminton teams. I also enjoy pencil sketching and am an avid Hindi poetry enthusiast. Whenever I find time, I like to express my thoughts through writing Hindi poetry.

I believe my strengths lie in my strong listening skills, effective communication, and sportsmanship. I approach people without judgment and value logic and reason over superstition.

specializations: Snooker & Pool, Cricket, Badminton, Hindi Poetry, Dance (Bhangra), Photography, Bowling Alley, Ice Skating, Go Karting
